definition: to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
surname Huai
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish

sentences.english: Immediately, for no reason, she has complete power of a man who's throwing himself at her.
sentences.chinese: 很快，她就會對這種投懷送抱的男人失去興趣。

sentences.english: Once your business hits the big time, you'll have hordes of women throwing themselves at you.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你事業成功，你就會有很多女人向你投懷送抱。

sentences.english: But when I was hurling my body onto yours , you did not seem to want to make it happen .
sentences.chinese: 但當我對你投懷送抱的時候，你似乎並不想讓它發生。

sentences.english: I saw a girl throw herself on him.
sentences.chinese: 我看到有一個女孩對他投懷送抱。

sentences.english: I saw a girl throw herself on you.
sentences.chinese: 我看到有一個女孩對你投懷送抱。

sentences.english: MM: I saw a girl throw herself on you. Who is she?
sentences.chinese: 我看到有一個女孩對你投懷送抱。她是誰？

definition: shameless
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
docile and obedient/all obedience
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
to use force
bastard/scoundrel/rogue
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
public place with numerous people
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
carelessly and haphazardly/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
shady relationship/affair/adulterous relationship
